item.title: Puzzle Quest: Immortal Edition announced for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
Publisher 505 Games and developer Infinity Plus 2 have announced Puzzle Quest: Immortal Edition, the definitive edition of the classic match-three puzzle game. It will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and GOG on September 18.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

The original match-three RPG is back! Puzzle Quest: Immortal Edition is the definitive Puzzle Quest, polished for a new era and featuring all the collected content from almost 20 years of history. Experience the original Puzzle Quest: Challenge of Warlords, Revenge of the Plague Lord, and The Legend Returns all together.

Puzzle Quest: Immortal Edition combines the classic match-three puzzle game with deep level role playing. Match three or more gems of the same color in a row to gain mana used to cast spells, battle opponents, collect items and rewards, and advance in the quests!

Key Features

  • Create a hero who gains skills and spells.
  • Match-three battles with varied opponents requiring different strategies.
  • Complete quests and side quests.
  • Meet companions who will aide you.
  • Learn spells and collect items.
  • Build your citadel—add buildings that grant you special powers.
  • Capture creatures, use them as mounts, and train them.
  • Capture monsters and play the research mini-game to learn their spells.
  • Discover hidden runes and create magical items in your citadel forge.
  • Siege cities around Etheria to expand your dominion.

Are you up to the challenge? Test your match-three skills as you battle against monsters and villains to save the kingdom of Etheria.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

item.title: Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake ‘Gameplay Overview’ trailer; scrolls and sigils detailed
item.content:encoded:
Get the details below.

■ New Items and Features Have Been Added to Greatly Enhance the Battles! Use a Variety of Strategies to Defeat the Monsters!

When exploring the overworld and dungeons in Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake, you will encounter monsters and launch into battle. Defeat monsters through turn-based command battles familiar to the Dragon Quest series! In battle, you can use weapons, as well as spells and skills with various effects to unleash a wide range of attacks.

Dragon Quest I

—Encounter monsters in the overworld and dungeons! Sometimes you’ll come across tough enemies.

Dragon Quest II

—When you enable suggested actions in the battle settings, spells and skills that exploit weaknesses will now be displayed in text above the enemy. Use this to help you choose the most effective way to battle.

■ Introducing the Unique Battle Features of the Hero and His Comrades! A Brand-New Item Makes an Appearance: The Scroll!

In Dragon Quest I, you will play as a single character, while in Dragon Quest II, you will play as a party of up to four characters as the story progresses. Each character has different spells and skills, so try to take advantage of their unique characteristics in battle. In this game, you can learn additional spells and skills by using a new item called scrolls.

Dragon Quest I

—Hero

On top of various sword techniques, he also wields Sizz-type and Zap-type spells. His ability “Dragon Slash” deals massive damage to dragons!

Dragon Quest II

—Prince of Midenhall

Besides unleashing attacks such as “Knuckle Sandwich” and “Hatchet Man,” he can also learn “Forbearance” to protect his allies, making him effective at both offense and defense.

—Prince of Cannock

Well-balanced in both sword skills and spells, he cannot only attack but also heal and support his allies. His “Gigaslash” attack, which sweeps away all enemies with a lightning blade, is devastating!

—Princess of Moonbrooke

With outstanding spell-casting abilities, she has mastered powerful offensive spells. She can also support her allies with support spells and healing spells such as “Oomph” and “Insulatle.”

—Princess of Cannock

With quick and agile movements, she can perform a variety of special moves and is also skilled at Frizz-type and Crack-type spells. However, she sometimes gets carried away and starts playing around during battle!

—Use the new scrolls to learn special skills and spells.

A new item, “scrolls,” has been added to this game! You can obtain scrolls from treasure chests and other places and by using them, one of your party members can learn a new spell or skill.

The teachings contained within scrolls can only be learned by certain characters.

■ Collect All Five Sigils to Unleash Various Effects During Battle!

The five sigils that appeared in the original Dragon Quest II, which hold the powers of the sun, star, moon, water, and soul, return in Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake. In this game, you will collect the five sigils throughout Dragon Quest I and Dragon Quest II. Furthermore, if you have a sigil, it will have various effects during battle when certain conditions are met. Each sigil has a different effect, so let’s take a look at some of them!

Dragon Quest I

—Sigils also appear in the HD-2D version of Dragon Quest I! In this game, you help the fairies create their sigils for a certain reason.

—When the sigil mark appears, the effect is activated! With the Sun Sigil, some special abilities will deal critical damage!

Dragon Quest II

—In Dragon Quest II, you must find the five sigils to defeat Hargon, the evil high priest who leads an army of monsters.

—If you have the Moon Sigil, some spells will act unpredictably.

The Effect of Soul Sigil Activates a Souped-Up Skill

When you have the Soul Sigil, certain abilities and spells will change during battle if specific conditions are met. Use these powerful Souped-Up Skills to defeat your enemies!

—If you input a certain command when selecting a spell or ability under specific conditions…

—The ability Dragon Slash is upgraded to the even more powerful Double Dragon Slash!

item.title: INDIKA coming to Switch this fall
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Currently available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC.

Publisher 11 bit studios and developer Odd Meter will release a Switch version of third-person story-driven game INDIKA this fall, the companies announced. A physical edition including the official soundtrack will be available via Silver Lining Interactive.

INDIKA first launched for PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and GOG on May 2, 2024, followed by PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series on May 17, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via 11 bit studios:

Meet a Not-So-Ordinary Nun

On the surface, Indika appears to be a humble nun trying to adapt to the rigid and monotonous rhythms of monastic life. But behind her quiet demeanour lies an unlikely friendship with the horn-headed tempter himself. This strange bond propels her into a world that feels torn from the pages of Dostoyevsky and Bulgakov, a place where the sacred and the profane intertwine, and where every step reveals new layers of mystery.

Enjoy an Indie Game Where Anything Goes

INDIKA isn’t afraid to challenge conventions, both in storytelling and in the wider gaming landscape. Developed by Odd Meter, a small, independent team formerly based in Moscow and now operating from Kazakhstan, the game combines richly atmospheric exploration, dark humour, and inventive puzzle-solving across surreal landscapes rendered in a unique visual style.

Key Features

  • Third-person adventure with an imaginative, darkly comic story.
  • A young nun’s journey of self-discovery in a surreal reimagining of 19th-century Russia.
  • The devil himself as an unlikely travel companion.
  • Unique puzzle elements woven into the narrative.
  • Surreal landscapes and atmospheric world-building.
  • 2D pixel art mini-games revealing Indika’s troubled past.
